pull.title: test: add missing sync to p2p_tx_download.py
pull.body:
If the node hasn't processed the inv from the outbound peer before the mocktime bump, the peer won't be preferred after the other inv timeouts, failing the test . Therefore, add a sync, just  like there is one after the `send_message` calls in the previous lines.

Fixes #31833

events.message:
test: add missing sync to p2p_tx_download.py

This prevents intermittent failures - if the node hasn't processed
the inv from the outbound peer before the mocktime bump, the peer
won't be preferred after the other inv timeouts, failing the test .
Therefore, add a sync, just like there is one after the send_message
calls in the previous lines.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -274,6 +274,7 @@ def test_preferred_tiebreaker_inv(self):
         pref_peer = self.nodes[0].add_outbound_p2p_connection(
            TestP2PConn(), wait_for_verack=True, p2p_idx=1, connection_type="outbound-full-relay")
         pref_peer.send_message(msg_inv([CInv(t=MSG_WTX, h=0xff00ff00)]))
+        pref_peer.sync_with_ping()

@@ -274,6 +274,7 @@ def test_preferred_tiebreaker_inv(self):
         pref_peer = self.nodes[0].add_outbound_p2p_connection(
            TestP2PConn(), wait_for_verack=True, p2p_idx=1, connection_type="outbound-full-relay")
         pref_peer.send_message(msg_inv([CInv(t=MSG_WTX, h=0xff00ff00)]))
+        pref_peer.sync_with_ping()
comments.body: There are not many remaining cases of `send_message`, so in theory it could be renamed to `send_without_ping` to make the misuse more apparent? Though, that'd be a follow-up.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -274,6 +274,7 @@ def test_preferred_tiebreaker_inv(self):
         pref_peer = self.nodes[0].add_outbound_p2p_connection(
            TestP2PConn(), wait_for_verack=True, p2p_idx=1, connection_type="outbound-full-relay")
         pref_peer.send_message(msg_inv([CInv(t=MSG_WTX, h=0xff00ff00)]))
+        pref_peer.sync_with_ping()
comments.body:
didn't get to it before merge.

>not many remaining cases

well, I count  ~130 still, so definitely some churn involved changing most of these. Still, it would make sense to me.

@@ -274,6 +274,7 @@ def test_preferred_tiebreaker_inv(self):
         pref_peer = self.nodes[0].add_outbound_p2p_connection(
            TestP2PConn(), wait_for_verack=True, p2p_idx=1, connection_type="outbound-full-relay")
         pref_peer.send_message(msg_inv([CInv(t=MSG_WTX, h=0xff00ff00)]))
+        pref_peer.sync_with_ping()
comments.body: seems to cause quite a few nuisance issues in tests, may be worth it going forward
